update.description:
While working on the undo feature, I realized the state of lights is not kept on the server side.

This pull request adds `Light` and `LightState` classes to physics, so that, besides helping with undo:

* If a light is moved while recording a log file, the movement is also reproduced during playback

* Resetting the world (Ctrl + R) also resets light poses

* Having lights be a `physics::Entity` paves the way for attaching lights to links (issue #900)

Requires [SDFormat pull request #227](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/227/add-light-state/diff)
update.title: physics::Light and physics::LightState

content.raw: I'll merge this since you're on vacation ;) I can revisit any issues when you're back.
content.html: I'll merge this since you're on vacation ;) I can revisit any issues when you're back.

content.html: Let me know if you're still reviewing this pull request ;)

content.raw:
Humm I'm not sure what I would expect. By the comment, I thought it was related to the logic of inserting and deleting models during log / playback, which is broken (has it ever worked?). So it seemed unnecessary to repeat the logic for lights and for the sake of coherence I removed the logic for models.

But yeah, I'm not entirely sure what this was doing here.
content.html:
Humm I'm not sure what I would expect. By the comment, I thought it was related to the logic of inserting and deleting models during log / playback, which is broken (has it ever worked?). So it seemed unnecessary to repeat the logic for lights and for the sake of coherence I removed the logic for models.

But yeah, I'm not entirely sure what this was doing here.
